content:
Here are some newer poetry anthologies from the past 5-10 years that feature works by women of color:

1. **"The BreakBeat Poets: Vol. 2, Black Girl Magic"** (2018) - Edited by Mahogany L. Browne, Imani Cezanne, and Jamila Woods, this anthology features poetry by black women and girls, exploring themes of identity, love, and social justice.
2. **"Nepantla: An Anthology for Queer Poets of Color"** (2018) - Edited by Christopher Soto, this anthology features poetry by queer poets of color, exploring themes of identity, love, and social justice.
3. **"Halal If You Hear Me"** (2019) - Edited by Fatimah Asghar and Safia Elhillo, this anthology features poetry by Muslim women, non-binary, and queer individuals, exploring themes of identity, faith, and social justice.
4. **"The Best American Poetry 2019"** (2019) - Edited by Major Jackson, this anthology features a diverse range of poets, including many women of color, and explores themes of identity, love, and social justice.
5. **"Inheritance: A Poetry Anthology"** (2020) - Edited by Natasha Trethewey and Jacqueline Trimble, this anthology features poetry by women of color, exploring themes of identity, family, and social justice.
6. **"Gathering Voices: An Anthology of Asian American Women's Poetry"** (2020) - Edited by Valerie Soe and Dawn Lundy Martin, this anthology features poetry by Asian American women, exploring themes of identity, family, and social justice.
7. **"When Women Write: A Poetry Anthology"** (2020) - Edited by Sophia Ahmed and Nausheen Eusuf, this anthology features poetry by women of color from Bangladesh and the diaspora, exploring themes of identity, love, and social justice.
8. **"PEN America Best Debut Short Stories 2020"** (2020) - While not exclusively a poetry anthology, this collection features short stories by emerging writers, including many women of color, and explores themes of identity, love, and social justice.
9. **"The World I Leave You: Asian American Poets on Faith and Spirit"** (2020) - Edited by Leah Silvieus and Gerald Maa, this anthology features poetry by Asian American poets, exploring themes of faith, identity, and social justice.
10. **"A Map Is Only One Story: Twenty Women and Men Writers on Immigration, Family, and the Meaning of Home"** (2020) - Edited by Nicole Chung and Mensah Demary, this anthology features essays and poetry by women of color, exploring themes of identity, family, and social justice.

These anthologies showcase the works of emerging and established women poets of color, offering a diverse range of voices, perspectives, and experiences.
